entry.title: Week 49, 2025: Unboxed arrays, flambda2 reaper enhancements, AVX2 SIMD support, and abstract kinds foundation work progressing
entry.content:
Summary

Abstract kinds foundation (2 large PRs under review), name mangling series (5 PRs), nullability/separability axis work continuing

Activity

  • Abstract kinds implementation proceeding through multi-PR series with #5070 refactoring to eliminate cyclic dependencies (1858 additions, 1498 deletions across 13 files) and #5071 adding basic abstract kinds and kind aliases (3241 additions, 1033 deletions, 103 files) both opened and under active review by Liam Stevenson and Richard Eisenberg
  • Name mangling overhaul advancing with five related PRs from Tim McGilchrist: reversible name mangling scheme (#5099), ocamlfilt demangler implementation (#5100), configuration options (#5097), improved debug tracking (#5098), and debug info gathering (#5096)
  • Nullability and separability work continuing with Zack Eisbach opening #5095 adding non_pointer64 on separability axis, #5086 making nullability scannable, and #5104 using scannable axes to influence Lambda translation
  • Reaper enhancements merged with #5081 adding auto mode for direct call preservation and #5043 implementing type rewriting in the reaper by Nathanaëlle Courant
  • Flambda2 indirect calls improved through #4809 adding set of possible code_ids to Indirect_known_arity call kind, enabling better optimization of indirect calls with known arity by Nathanaëlle Courant
  • Backend register allocation refactored with #4888 making Reg.t private by Greta Yorsh in preparation for register aliases with accurate types
  • Quotation improvements progressing with Jakub Bachurski working on disambiguation (#5094), elaboration framework (#5090), test organization (#5089), and annotation fixes (#5083)
  • Datalog provenance enhanced by Basile Clément with #5091 allowing dynamic enabling at rule evaluation time rather than module load time
  • Unboxed arrays expanded with James Rayman continuing work on #4643 for int8#, int16#, and int# arrays (3677 additions, 70 files)
  • Register allocation affinity under development in #5059 by Xavier Clerc implementing basic affinity support for all three allocators
  • Flambda2 inlining refined through #5093 by Basile Clément considering value arguments non-useful for speculative inlining decisions
  • CFG dataflow refactored in #5045 by Greta Yorsh unifying forward and backward analysis types
  • Documentation efforts advancing with Basile Clément creating encyclopædia of flambda2 optimizations in #5082
  • Local mode pointers being debugged in #5087 by Ryan Tjoa fixing segfault with %unsafe_set_ptr and NULL base
  • Shapes format under consideration in #5103 by Simon Spies for flipping default format
  • ASAN runtime optimization proposed in #5102 by Kevin Svetlitski to disable instrumentation in compiler's own runtime, reducing compilation overhead from 40-45% to 20-25%
entry.summary: Unboxed arrays, flambda2 reaper enhancements, AVX2 SIMD support, and abstract kinds foundation work progressing

entry.title: Week 48, 2025: Backend optimization surge with 10 x86 peephole PRs, type system improvements, and new intrinsics support
entry.content:
Summary

26 new PRs opened including abstract kinds preparation, typed ARM64 DSL, and separability axis work; backend optimization continues

Activity

  • New PRs opened this week include abstract kinds preparation by Chris Casinghino (#5070), typed ARM64 DSL by Mark Shinwell (#5037), separability axis scannable conversion by Zack Eisbach (#5031), register allocation affinity support by Xavier Clerc (#5059), and x86 peephole optimizations continuation (#5063)
  • Backend optimization surge led by Xavier Clerc with 10 merged PRs implementing x86 peephole rules for redundant comparison removal (#5028), MOV-to-LEA rewriting (#5018), MOV-to-XCHG optimization (#5016), useless move deletion (#4985), MOV chain optimization (#4977), infrastructure refactoring (#5032, #4975), CI testing (#4976), and IRC refactoring (#4594)
  • Type system evolution with Liam Stevenson optimizing jkind normalization fuel (#5047, #5009) and environment fold operations (#5066), James Rayman re-enabling unboxed module elements (#5064), Zesen Qian adding staticity checking (#5054) and mode hints (#5053), and Vincent Laviron fixing classic mode approximations (#5058)
  • Intrinsics expansion by Max Slater adding 128-bit integer operations (#5025) and BMI/BMI2 support (#5065)
  • Flambda2 cleanup with Basile Clément removing 3-year-old disabled code age relation join (#5051) and improving chamelon (#5061), Nathanaëlle Courant refactoring reaper code (#5049, #5038)
  • Ongoing work includes reaper type rewriting (#5043), GADT with-bounds re-enablement (#5046), typed ARM64 DSL (#5037), flambda2 type interface (#5050), debugging improvements by Simon Spies (#4916, #4961, #4928), name mangling scheme by Tim McGilchrist (#4850), and untagged int arrays by James Rayman (#4779, #4643, #4936)
  • Developer tooling improvements including manifest files by Andrei Odintsov (#4986), magic number bump by @dkalinichenko-js (#5048), boot directory removal by Jacob Van Buren (#5067), test fix by Vesa Karvonen (#5042), and documentation typo fix by BuzzY_ (#5069)
entry.summary: Backend optimization surge with 10 x86 peephole PRs, type system improvements, and new intrinsics support

entry.title: Week 47, 2025: Mixed module support, type system improvements, runtime optimizations, backend enhancements, and probes implementation
entry.content:
Summary

Active development across type system, backend optimizations, runtime improvements, and open PRs for SIMD and layouts

Activity

  • Newly opened PRs include separability as scannable axis renaming pointerness (#5031), fuel optimization with linear consumption (#5009), AVX2 gather intrinsics support (#5040), 128-bit integer arithmetic intrinsics (#5025), staticity mode checking (#5029), immutable arrays of unboxed products (#5026), typed DSL for arm64 (#5037), and module mode hint system (#5034)
  • Type system improvements delivered through Tof_jkind for unboxed existentials and Tpolys by Liam Stevenson (#4995), v1 safety check optimization avoiding substitutions (#5039), and upstream PR 13866 with marking mechanism updates (#5015)
  • Backend enhancements include probes code generation refactoring by Greta Yorsh (#5011), CFG profiling counters for instructions, blocks, and moves by Xavier Clerc (#5027), and CFG terminator simplification reinstated with reducibility check (#4921)
  • Runtime optimizations landed via marking loop optimization removing global access by Nick Barnes (#4997), sweep loop global variable elimination (#5022), and multidomain testing without stack-checks by Vesa Karvonen (#5019)
  • Infrastructure updates merged including metrics collection refactor for per-artifact tracking by Xavier Clerc (#5003), compiler profile data archiving (#5004), Dune version bump to 3.17.2 by Sadiq Jaffer (#5000), and Chamelon boot compiler compatibility by Basile Clément (#5020)
  • Active development continues on .cmxs format optimization with consolidated imports (#5014), slambda splices integration (#5023), arm64 intrinsics for RDTSC and CRC32 (#5024), reaper consistency for apply (#5038), dump-dir race condition fix (#5010), and manifest files support (#4986)
entry.summary: Mixed module support, type system improvements, runtime optimizations, backend enhancements, and probes implementation

entry.title: Week 46, 2025: Modes system enhancements, SIMD intrinsics expansion, slambda IR introduction, and metaprogramming improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Twenty-seven new PRs opened covering pointerness axes, jkind normalization, probes, metaprogramming, and GC optimizations

Activity

  • New PRs opened include downstream of ocaml/ocaml#13866 for occur_rec optimization by Liam Stevenson (#5015), unboxed module elements allowing non-value fields by James Rayman (#4020), Tof_jkind for unboxed existentials by Liam Stevenson (#4995), pointerness as scannable axis by Zack Eisbach (#5006), runtime metaprogramming extension by Andrej Ivašković (#5012), and fuel increase to 10 with linear normalization by Liam Stevenson (#5009)
  • Backend and infrastructure work progressing with .cmxs format changes for import headers by Simon Spies (#5014), debug info ordering fix between Name_for_debugger and stack spilling (#5013), unoptimized probes implementation by Mark Shinwell (#4991) and Greta Yorsh (#5007), probes refactoring (#5011), compile-time arch constants (#4972), and x86 peephole optimization for dead register moves by Xavier Clerc (#4985)
  • Metrics and CI improvements delivered through per-artifact size tracking instead of aggregation by Xavier Clerc (#5003), profile collection alongside artifact sizes (#5004), CFG instruction equality functions (#5002), and -dump-dir race condition fix (#5010)
  • Type system and modes development advancing with metaprogramming review by Jack Rickard (#4981), arrays of GC-ignorable values by @dkalinichenko-js (#4963), crossing parsing support by Zack Eisbach (#4781), limited mod contended inference (#4929), and Typeopt.value_kind level preservation (#4549)
  • Debugging infrastructure work including LLDB OxCaml language plugin by Simon Spies (#4961), function sections with DWARF support (#4934), and reversible name mangling scheme by Tim McGilchrist (#4850)
  • Runtime and GC optimization explored through effect primitives refactoring removing Must_not_enter_gc by Aspen Smith (#4901), preemption implementation (#4881), and major GC marking loop optimization by Nick Barnes (#4997)
  • Miscellaneous improvements including manifest files support by Andrei Odintsov (#4986), dune version documentation update by Sadiq Jaffer (#5000), and Ccatch simplification for boolean computation by Xavier Clerc (#4998)
entry.summary: Modes system enhancements, SIMD intrinsics expansion, slambda IR introduction, and metaprogramming improvements

entry.title: Week 45, 2025: Significant progress on modes, SIMD support, and Unix module annotations with 34 PRs merged and 17 new PRs opened.
entry.content:
Summary

17 new PRs opened including SIMD enhancements and peephole optimizations, with 34 PRs merged covering modes, quotations, and tooling.

Activity

  • New PRs opened this week include #4987 and #4988 for SIMD improvements (stop sign-extending small int casts, generalize memory operands), #4982 for a new sharable mode, #4983 to move share_context to mode hints, and several WIP PRs from Xavier Clerc on x86 peephole optimizations (#4973, #4975, #4977, #4985)
  • Mode system improvements were a major theme with Zesen Qian contributing #4792 (convert mode to constant in cmi), #4984 (disallow legacy mode syntax in comprehension), #4968 (compiler no longer prints old mode/modality syntax), #4979 (remove excessive parentheses in mode error hints), and #4978 (add missing Skip hints for monadic modes)
  • Quotations and splicing saw fixes with Jakub Bachurski landing #4974 for inclusion checks with quotes and splices, Leo White fixing quotation unification in #4906, and Zesen Qian fixing constructor quotation locks in #4910
  • Compiler internals improved with Liam Stevenson making module finding lazy in #4970, Mark Shinwell removing global state from Linkenv in #4947, and Luke Maurer fixing a segfault by disallowing aliases to parameter modules in #4948
  • Type system and jkinds work included Andrej Ivašković adding levels to sort variables in #4785, Dmitrii Kalinichenko fixing or_null with default optional arguments in #4953 and landing #4891 for exceptions crossing statefulness and visibility
  • Documentation and tooling updates included Max Slater fixing tutorial typos in #4954 and #4969, Zesen Qian rewording allocation hints in #4957, and Xavier Clerc restoring oxcaml-metrics push in #4967
entry.summary: Significant progress on modes, SIMD support, and Unix module annotations with 34 PRs merged and 17 new PRs opened.

entry.title: Week 44, 2025: Thread naming support, Flambda2 type system improvements, CI infrastructure upgrades, and DWARF debugging enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Flambda2 type system work, modality system improvements, DWARF debugging advances, and parameterized modules refinements

Activity

  • Flambda2 type system enhancement with relations stored as projections in type kinds, enabling precise tracking during n-way joins for the match-in-match heuristic by Basile Clément with extensive review from Vincent Laviron (#4390)
  • Profiling infrastructure for speculative inlining added by Basile Clément to better understand compilation behavior (#4375)
  • Domain index exposure proposed by Vesa Karvonen adding Domain.self_index API for per-domain array elements to avoid contention, referencing upstream ocaml/ocaml#13171 (#4950)
  • Linkenv refactoring by Mark Shinwell removing global state to simplify code and support future work, under review by Jack Rickard (#4947)
  • Natdynlink performance improvement using skiplist instead of linked list for module GC roots by Nicolas Trangez, enabling efficient duplicate checking during dynamic linking (#4949)
  • Parameterized modules segfault fix disallowing aliases to parameter modules to prevent signature substitution issues until transparent ascription is available (#4948)
  • DWARF debugging advances including layout improvements for runtime type information by Simon Spies (#4916), shape constructors for unknown types (#4928), function sections support (#4934), and phantom variable support by Mark Shinwell (#4595)
  • Modality system work with @@ global implying @@ aliased for borrowing soundness by @dkalinichenko-js (#4889), mod bound parsing refactoring (#4931), mod contended inference (#4929, #4944), exceptions crossing statefulness and visibility (#4891), and stdlib stateless annotations (#4839, #4930)
  • Stdlib local annotations for printing functions by @tkoukpari across multiple iterations (#4937, #4938, #4943)
  • Mixed modules progress with automatic field reordering by James Rayman (#4020) and unsigned divmod work (#4936)
  • Layout system improvements using Lambda.layout for transl_exp and preserving levels in Typeopt.value_kind by @dkalinichenko-js (#4582, #4549)
  • Type system testing adding jkind subsumption across files test by Aspen Smith with review from Liam Stevenson (#4922)
  • Backend optimizations including CFG peephole rules for neutral elements (#4932), float value propagation (#4879), terminator simplification extensions (#4807), and CFG reducibility work by Xavier Clerc (#4920, #4921)
  • Name mangling scheme development by Tim McGilchrist enabling reversible demangling with full module paths for improved debugging (#4850)
  • Preemption support ongoing work by Aspen Smith (#4881)
  • Runtime improvements including memprof configuration on major heap by Stephen Dolan (#4939) and to_cmm illegal reordering prevention by Guillaume Bury (#4941)
  • CI metrics enhancement for compiler profile data collection by Xavier Clerc (#4942)
  • Frametables configuration option for .lrodata placement to handle large code sizes by Mark Shinwell (#4905)
  • Match-in-match heuristic development with improved naked immediate meets by Basile Clément (#4374, #4394)
entry.summary: Thread naming support, Flambda2 type system improvements, CI infrastructure upgrades, and DWARF debugging enhancements

entry.title: Week 43, 2025: Runtime improvements for threading and GC control, mode system enhancements, and compiler bug fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Runtime threading improvements, mode system refinements, and ongoing work on preemption, name mangling, and parsing features

Activity

  • Preemption support under development with 2500+ line draft PR affecting 62 files for concurrent execution control by Aspen Smith (#4881)
  • Name mangling scheme in progress with reversible mangling for full module path reconstruction and demangling implementations for LLVM, Linux kernel, and binutils by Tim McGilchrist (#4850)
  • Crossing syntax parsing adding mod support for per-value mode tracking with 1100+ line implementation by Zack Eisbach (#4781)
  • Mixed modules with non-values allowing automatic reordering of module fields to support unboxed types across module boundaries by James Rayman (#4020)
  • Effect primitive refactoring to remove Must_not_enter_gc module by making %resume take continuation directly instead of unpacked fields by Aspen Smith (#4901)
  • Backup thread locking improvements extending caml_locking_scheme interface with better backup thread interactions for custom locking schemes by Stephen Dolan (#4914)
  • Quotation system fixes addressing unification bugs in quote/splice handling for metaprogramming by Leo White (#4906, #4911, #4912)
  • Constructor quotation locks bug fixing predef type checking to properly handle locally-defined constructors by Zesen Qian (#4910)
  • Frametable relocation optimization proposing .lrodata section placement to reduce text section size and prevent linker failures under default code model by Mark Shinwell (#4905)
  • CFG reducibility checking and related terminator simplification improvements for backend optimization by Xavier Clerc (#4920, #4921, #4807, #4879)
  • Untagged int arrays implementation adding int8#, int16#, and int# array support with proper tag selection and indexing by James Rayman (#4643)
  • jsofocaml integration comprehensive test suite and CI updates for JavaScript backend testing by Jacob Van Buren (#4753)
  • CI runner upgrades enabling larger build machines for faster compilation and test execution by Jacob Van Buren (#4908)
  • LLVM backend flag control adding -no-llvm-backend option for selective testing by Greta Yorsh (#4904)
  • Primitive list generation tool discussion about auto-generating comprehensive primitive documentation by James Rayman (#4812)
  • Debug information layouts improving runtime type representation for flattened arrays by Simon Spies (#4916)
  • Slambda IR development introducing static evaluation phase between translation and lambda with trivial initial implementation by Luke Maurer (#4776)
  • Mode system refinements including hints for containing types, global/aliased implications, and Lambda.layout usage by @dkalinichenko-js (#4919, #4889, #4582, #4549)
  • Jkind subsumption test reproducing cross-file bug for investigation by Aspen Smith (#4922)
  • Ikind system prototype implementing new subsumption and mode crossing algorithms behind -extension ikinds flag by @julesjacobs (#4675)
  • VERSION file cleanup removing installation dependency to match upstream OCaml by @dkalinichenko-js (#4924)
  • Typeopt level preservation fixing unintended type variable level changes affecting principal typing and nullability by @dkalinichenko-js (#4549)
  • Lex directory removal cleaning up unused lexer code and dependent tests by James Rayman (#4925)
entry.summary: Runtime improvements for threading and GC control, mode system enhancements, and compiler bug fixes

entry.title: Week 42, 2025: Metaprogramming quotation fixes, type system improvements, and compiler debugger enhancements merged this week
entry.content:
Summary

Metaprogramming work and Flambda2 optimizations dominate activity with 10 new PRs opened and ongoing work on modes and effects

Activity

  • New PRs opened this week include continuation handling improvements by Aspen Smith (#4901), metaprogramming mdx fixes by Mark Shinwell (#4900, #4899), Unix local/read annotations by Vesa Karvonen (#4830), preemption support (#4881), CFG value propagation for floats by Xavier Clerc (#4879), extended CFG terminator simplification (#4807), and modes work including global/aliased implications by @dkalinichenko-js (#4889), mode variable conversion (#4792), exception crossing improvements (#4891), and external array renaming (#4890)
  • Metaprogramming infrastructure advanced with quotation evaluation fixes merged by Jack Rickard addressing exception handling and primitive addresses (#4896), double-linking prevention for eval support files by Mark Shinwell (#4895), and ongoing work on Camlinternaleval dependencies (#4899, #4900) after closing superseded work (#4894)
  • Flambda2 optimization work delivered n-way join analysis exposure by Basile Clément (#4821), datalog Virtual_machine.iterator cleanup (#4897), and reverted static constant sharing due to backtrace issues (#4893) though it was briefly merged (#4800)
  • Backend and type system improvements included CFG terminator simplification revert due to loop information issues by Xavier Clerc (#4885), private Reg.t refactoring in progress by Greta Yorsh (#4888), bits8/bits16 kinds compatibility by Nailen Matschke (#4898), and path loading fix by Andrei Odintsov (#4878)
  • Infrastructure and tooling updates included GDB memsearch utility improvements by Nick Barnes (#4886), const qualifiers for camlstartup functions (#4882), cfgtool.exe development for debugging CFG issues (#4596), config variables printing work (#4873), toplevel expunging fix by David Allsopp (#4877), and shrink-wrapping CI testing (#4892)
  • Ongoing runtime and effects work includes domain lock unification by Stephen Dolan (#4769), preemption implementation by Aspen Smith (#4881), continuation handling improvements (#4901), and GC check skipping for external arrays (#4622)
entry.summary: Metaprogramming quotation fixes, type system improvements, and compiler debugger enhancements merged this week

entry.title: Week 41, 2025: Runtime quotations and js_of_ocaml integration landed alongside DWARF debugging improvements and block indices moving to stable
entry.content:
Summary

23 new PRs opened including preemption, staticity mode axis, and n-way join analysis, plus metaprogramming and JavaScript backend work completed

Activity

  • Twenty-three new PRs opened this week representing future work: preemption by Aspen Smith (#4881), staticity mode axis by Zesen Qian (#4799), n-way join analysis exposure by Basile Clément (#4821), extended CFG terminator simplification by Xavier Clerc (#4807), Unix params annotations by Vesa Karvonen (#4830), -quiet flag for ocamldebug by Jakub Bachurski (#4869), print all config variables by Greta Yorsh (#4873), workflow promote failed diffs by Xavier Clerc (#4808), reversible name mangling by Tim McGilchrist (#4850), Classic mode fallback inlining switch-off by Vincent Laviron (#4845), CI warning addition by Jacob Van Buren (#4867), ocamlj testing and CI by Jacob Van Buren (#4753), compiler and driver changes for jsofocaml by Jacob Van Buren (#4791), automatic module field reordering for mixed modules by James Rayman (#4020), flambda2 test tools building by Basile Clément (#4851), stdlib.mli stateless annotations by @dkalinichenko-js (#4839), slambda with trivial transl and eval by Luke Maurer (#4776), levels for variable sorting by Andrej Ivašković (#4785), JSIR naked int32 array initialization optimization by Leo Lee (#4741), parsing crossings support by Zack Eisbach (#4781), mode to constant conversion for cmi by Zesen Qian (#4792), prototype ikind system by @julesjacobs (#4675), and metrics upload artifacts exploration by Jacob Van Buren (#4848)
  • Metaprogramming infrastructure delivered through runtime quotations with new <[ ]> syntax and $ splicing by Andrej Ivašković merging foundational PR with 9,312 additions (#4395), parse tree quotation nodes by Andrej Ivašković (#4852), backend driver support by Jack Rickard and Mark Shinwell (#4864), quotation evaluation by Jack Rickard (#4874), and ocaml-jit integration by Jack Rickard (#4855, #4856)
  • JavaScript backend maturation through complete jsofocaml compiler import with 303,437 additions by Jacob Van Buren (#4730), JSIR symbol imports compilation unit by Leo Lee (#4737), bytecode primitives in JSIR mode by Leo Lee (#4739), and JSIR documentation by Leo Lee (#4743)
  • DWARF debugging improvements encompassing register availability analysis fixes by Mark Shinwell and Greta Yorsh (#4835, #4870), experimental codegen flag by Mark Shinwell (#4871), Alias binding substitution restriction by Mark Shinwell (#4872), inlined frames for specialised code by Vincent Laviron fixing #4831 (#4842), spill placement fixes by Mark Shinwell (#4837), Namefordebugger at tailrec_entry by Greta Yorsh (#4863), dummy probe notes by Greta Yorsh (#4834), and test identifier filtering by Simon Spies (#4829)
  • Type system and unboxed types work including block indices moving to stable by Ryan Tjoa (#4827), atomic fields disallowance by Ryan Tjoa (#4824), flattened float fields with unboxed types by Ryan Tjoa (#4826), unsafe pointer primitives by Ryan Tjoa (#4828), Lambda layouts externality use by Jakub Bachurski and Ryan Tjoa (#4853), polymorphic variants with-bounds restoration by Liam Stevenson and Richard Eisenberg (#4847), jkind normalization fix by Liam Stevenson (#4777), mode system refactoring by Zesen Qian (#4790), atomic fields in mixed blocks forbidding by Aspen Smith (#4868), and Multicore.spawn soundness fix by Vesa Karvonen (#4875)
  • Backend and compilation improvements with CFG terminator simplification by Xavier Clerc (#4772), optcomp backend parameterization by Jacob Van Buren (#4825), asmlink file splitting by Jacob Van Buren (#4838), location-based Reg.t containers by Basile Clément (#4865), Flambda nullable kinds printer by Basile Clément (#4823), and Bytes.get/String.get bytecode differentiation by Jérôme Vouillon (#4782)
  • CI and build system enhancements through dependency simplification by Jacob Van Buren (#4833), Dune max version check removal by Xavier Clerc (#4866), ocamlformat speedups by Jacob Van Buren (#4857), further CI acceleration by Jacob Van Buren (#4858), macOS CI load reduction by Jacob Van Buren (#4859), workflow conditional syntax fixing by Jacob Van Buren (#4860), diff application workflow by Xavier Clerc (#4810), Nix flake github-actions by George Shammas (#4711), Dune version update in default.nix by Jacob Van Buren (#4846), and metrics script fix by @spiessimon merged as #4844
  • Tooling and quality improvements with AGENTS.md documentation by Jacob Van Buren (#4849), type path printing penalization by Nailen Matschke (#4832), zero_alloc warning scope fix by Greta Yorsh (#4819), version bump to 5.2.0minus-22 by Mark Shinwell (#4876), over-expunged toplevel fix by David Allsopp (#4877), and code formatting by Jacob Van Buren (#4843, #4836)
entry.summary: Runtime quotations and js_of_ocaml integration landed alongside DWARF debugging improvements and block indices moving to stable

entry.title: Week 40, 2025: Datalog infrastructure improvements, js_of_ocaml integration, mode system evolution, and match-in-match bug fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Focus on jsofocaml integration, mode system refactoring with new staticity axis, datalog improvements, and block indices stabilization

Activity

  • Jsofocaml integration progressing with compiler and driver changes by Jacob Van Buren generating extensive discussion with 46 comments (#4791), plus sourcemap fixes (#4792) and linking optimizations (#4793)
  • Mode system refactoring by Zesen Qian to simplify adding new axes (#4789), convert modes to constants in .cmi files (#4790), and introduce new staticity mode axis with active discussion (#4799)
  • Block indices moving to stable with Ryan Tjoa implementing unboxed versions for flattened float fields (#4826), stabilization (#4827), and new unsafe get/set primitives (#4828)
  • Datalog improvements with five merged PRs by Basile Clément fixing break instruction printer (#4814), removing awkward APIs (#4815), explicit query representation (#4816), high-level variable storage (#4817), and provenance debugging (#4818), plus ongoing work exposing join analysis (#4819)
  • CI infrastructure enhancements with Xavier Clerc adding PR number tracking to metrics (#4822) and building workflow automation for test promotion (#4808, #4809)
  • Flambda2 optimizations including zero-alloc warning scope fix by Greta Yorsh (#4811), continuation specialization fix by Guillaume Bury resolving three match-in-match issues (#4751), and reaper improvements preserving direct calls in zero-alloc functions by Nathanaëlle Courant (#4787)
  • Type system work with atomic field restrictions (#4824), jkind annotation prefixes (#4795), monadic closure axes handling (#4798), and improved error messages (#4719)
  • Other ongoing work includes backend parameterization for optcomp (#4823), CFG terminator simplification (#4807), automatic primitive list generation (#4812), static constant sharing restoration (#4800), and testsuite cleanup (#4794)
entry.summary: Datalog infrastructure improvements, js_of_ocaml integration, mode system evolution, and match-in-match bug fixes

entry.title: Week 39, 2025: Major TLS implementation, new forkable mode axis, LLVM backend improvements, and CI metrics collection infrastructure
entry.content:
Summary

Large jsofocaml import, jkind normalization fix, slambda IR prototype, mixed block shape improvements, and CI automation enhancements

Activity

  • Large-scale import by Jacob Van Buren bringing jsofocaml into OxCaml with 348k+ additions affecting build system and middle end (#4753)
  • Type system improvements including sort variable levels by Andrej Ivašković for layout polymorphism (#4785) and jkind normalization fix for modalities by Liam Stevenson (#4777)
  • Prototype ikind system by @julesjacobs introducing new algorithms for subsumption and mode crossing behind -extension ikinds flag (#4675)
  • Static lambda IR development by Luke Maurer introducing slambda with trivial translation and evaluation, adding new -dslambda flag (#4776)
  • LLVM backend enhancements by Yusuf Onur Üşümez including pseudoreg rewriting disabling (#4765), exception handling improvements (#4757), and frametable fixes (#4760)
  • Bytecode compilation improvements by Jérôme Vouillon differentiating Bytes.get from String.get for jsofocaml compatibility (#4782)
  • Mode system refinements by Zesen Qian removing hints from mode variables after type checking to reduce file sizes (#4766) and improving error reporting (#4719)
  • CI infrastructure by Xavier Clerc adding automated metrics collection (#4762, #4768, #4770, #4771) and CFG terminator simplification for better loop compilation (#4772)
  • Documentation fixes by Chris Casinghino addressing dead oxcaml.org links (#4774)
  • Domain improvements by Stephen Dolan disentangling Domain.spawn from interrupt logic (#4764) and enabling parallel tests (#4763)
entry.summary: Major TLS implementation, new forkable mode axis, LLVM backend improvements, and CI metrics collection infrastructure

entry.title: Week 38, 2025: Major LLVM backend refactor merged alongside 17 other PRs, with new JavaScript backend improvements and domain memory management fixes
entry.content:
Summary

21 new PRs opened including JSOO integration, with ongoing JSIR optimizations and three new match-in-match compilation issues reported

Activity

  • Nine new PRs opened that remain unmerged including JSOO integration by Jacob Van Buren (#4730), TLS implementation take 2 by Max Slater (#4738), and JSIR optimizations by Leo Lee (#4741, #4737, #4739, #4724)
  • JavaScript backend development accelerated with Leo Lee contributing multiple fixes for JSIR including unbound variable resolution (#4727) and proper match exhaustion improvements by James Rayman (#4729)
  • Mode system enhancements by Zesen Qian including Mode.Crossing usage in jkinds (#4273) and improved error message formatting (#4719)
  • Core runtime improvements merged including poll insertion test fixes (#4735), TLS revert (#4734), and prologue optimization deletion (#4720) by Mark Shinwell and Greta Yorsh
  • Compiler backend fixes including shrink-wrapping improvements by Christos Falas (#4616) and Fexpr fixes by Basile Clément (#4725)
entry.summary: Major LLVM backend refactor merged alongside 17 other PRs, with new JavaScript backend improvements and domain memory management fixes

entry.title: Week 37, 2025: Major infrastructure development with JSIR backend, TLS implementation, small integers expansion, and comprehensive DWARF debugging improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Major development across JavaScript backend, threading infrastructure, small integers, debugging, and performance optimizations with 27 new PRs and 48 merges

Activity

  • Major ongoing development with 27 new PRs opened including prototype ikind system by @julesjacobs (#4675), untagged char range patterns by James Rayman (#4716), and dataflow-based shrink wrapping by Christos Falas (#4710)
  • JavaScript backend reached major milestone with Leo Lee merging 12+ PRs for comprehensive JSIR implementation (#4638, #4717, #4715, #4714, #4708, #4709) plus Mark Shinwell adding dynamic width selection (#4681)
  • Threading infrastructure delivered through TLS implementation (#4671), DLS portability improvements (#4630), and format module integration by Max Slater
  • Small integers expansion with unboxed literals (#4635), char literals (#4658), array indexing (#4677, #4691), and Char_u module (#4659) by James Rayman and Richard Eisenberg

  • Nullability fast-path optimization improving performance for null-checking operations (e1ef6f059170bfed869f56ccdb2e78377720ca5b)
  • Datalog dependency cleanup removing Named_ref dependencies from trie.ml and leapfrog.ml for better modularity (b584f5fb39faae843e6241745bc8eb5f70e03f82)
entry.summary: Major week with new alternative Effects API, `-infer-with-bounds` flag removal, record field reordering, and 25 commits across runtime, typing, and backend systems

entry.title: Week 9, 2025: Core compiler improvements with instruction ID abstraction, GC work accounting fixes, and new stack allocation documentation
entry.content:
Summary

Type-directed integer literal disambiguation and runtime quotations PRs opened, with ongoing sign-extension validation discussion

Activity

  • Type-directed disambiguation for integer literals opened by Jacob Van Buren to reduce verbosity of unboxed types using type annotations (#3617)
  • Runtime quotations implementation in development by Andrej Ivašković introducing <[, ]> bracket syntax and AST-like structure with stage typing (#4395)
  • Sign-extension validation issue raised by Jacob Van Buren regarding proper sign-extension of int32 values in mixed blocks for Flambda2 compatibility (#3638)
entry.summary: Core compiler improvements with instruction ID abstraction, GC work accounting fixes, and new stack allocation documentation

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: Major week with 20 commits including runtime events fixes, capsule API improvements, and extensive Flambda2 enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive lambda function system refactoring, Flambda2 region tracking improvements, and comprehensive ephemeron garbage collection fixes

Activity

  • Lambda function system overhaul with significant changes to Lambda.lfunction structure including cleanup of ret_mode and region fields, affecting core compilation pipeline (1a73a72)
  • Flambda2 parent region tracking implementation providing enhanced memory management capabilities for the advanced optimizer (92d8707)
  • CMM unboxed field operations refactoring improving backend code generation for unboxed record and variant field access (d6971f8)
  • Ephemeron garbage collection improvements with proper clearing of ephemerons during minor GC cycles, affecting weak reference behavior (c1a0500)
  • Flambda2 axis normalization optimization skipping irrelevant axes during normalize operations for improved compilation performance (a41be0f)
  • Build system improvements with conditional OCAMLPARAM setting only when BUILD_OCAMLPARAM is defined (a7eb552)
  • Memory tracing enhancements porting upstream memtrace improvements for better debugging capabilities (eb3fbc8)
  • Test infrastructure updates including functorized test improvements in test_gen_u_array.ml and probe handler parameter fixes (dbfaa32, e743d6c)
entry.summary: Major week with 20 commits including runtime events fixes, capsule API improvements, and extensive Flambda2 enhancements

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: Major jkind system improvements with 30 commits including with-kinds implementation, AddressSanitizer support, and runtime enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

One new issue reported regarding an elusive arm64+greedy compilation bug with cross-references to related issues

Activity

  • Compilation bug investigation by Xavier Clerc reporting arm64+greedy miscompilation issue (#3574) with cross-references to related failures in #3496 and #3561
  • Bug reproduction efforts by Basile Clément setting up compile loops with different random seeds on arm64 machines to get consistent reproducer
entry.summary: Major jkind system improvements with 30 commits including with-kinds implementation, AddressSanitizer support, and runtime enhancements

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: Expanded zero-alloc infrastructure with new command-line tools, enhanced unboxed type support, and improved compiler optimization features
entry.content:
Summary

Major compiler infrastructure improvements with 17 merged PRs focusing on zero-alloc checking, type system enhancements, and optimization features

Activity

  • Zero-alloc infrastructure expansion with major improvements including new command-line flag support (#3125), custom error messaging (#3143, #3228), and new assumeunlessopt payload (#3140)
  • Type system enhancements including removal of restrictions on non-value types in unboxed types (#3558), improved field_set behavior (#3550), and enhanced shift operations (#3523)
  • Flambda2 type system improvements with enhanced meet operations returning new typing environments (#3537), constant aliasing support (#3539), and continued work on issue #2857 (#3528)
  • Compiler pipeline refinements including updated CMM helpers interface for additional integer sizes (#3415), CFG polling optimizations (#3390), and debug information enhancements (#3118)
  • Documentation and testing improvements with enhanced unboxed types documentation (#3531), improved variable printing (#3546), and string validation fixes (#3540)
  • Runtime quotations development with Andrej Ivašković continuing work on comprehensive runtime quotations implementation including AST representation, staging support, and parsing infrastructure (#4395)
entry.summary: Expanded zero-alloc infrastructure with new command-line tools, enhanced unboxed type support, and improved compiler optimization features

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: Major week with unboxed records feature implementation, GC improvements, and backend optimizations
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive development on unboxed types, uniqueness analysis, GC fixes, and backend optimizations across multiple PRs

Activity

  • Unboxed records implementation represents the biggest feature addition with comprehensive syntax support including record creation #{field = value}, pattern matching #{}, field access E.#l, and full type system integration (#3229)
  • Uniqueness analysis improvements with stable DRF uniqueness implementation (#3319), overwrite expression cherry-picking (#3310), and pattern consumption for unique barriers (#3335)
  • Garbage collection fixes addressing ephemeron-adoption problems (#3332), mark-delay pacing issues (#3331), and minor GC requests when marking fails (#3333), with one fix reverted (#3341)
  • Backend optimizations for unboxed products on ARM64 (#3343) and unboxed pair returns from C externals (#3337)
  • Development infrastructure improvements with macOS CI tweaks (#3342), modality semantics workarounds (#3338), and PPX attribute handling improvements (#3334)
entry.summary: Major week with unboxed records feature implementation, GC improvements, and backend optimizations

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Week featured new template instantiation features, major capsule API enhancements, and extensive CFG backend refactoring work
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive CFG backend refactoring with new modules and performance improvements, plus CI infrastructure updates

Activity

  • CFG backend restructuring with extraction of common elements into dedicated modules including new cfgize_utils.ml and polling_utils.ml modules (#3294, #3295)
  • CFG selection improvements including avoidance of polymorphic compare operations (#3314), removal of debugging statements (#3313), and fixes to trywith expression handling (#3312)
  • New Sub_cfg module extracted to handle sub-control flow graph operations (#3322)
  • Performance optimization for flush_delayed_lets function when processing large expressions (#3315)
  • Build and CI infrastructure updates including migration from macos-12 to macos-latest (#3308) and macOS CI tweaks (#3320)
  • Unique barrier creation now controlled by a dedicated flag (#3271)
  • Code quality improvements with "contains calls" judgement moved to cfg.ml (#3323) and fixes to Terminator case in emittailapply (#3324)
  • Test infrastructure fixes including backtrace test with embedded line numbers from compiler (#3087)
entry.summary: Week featured new template instantiation features, major capsule API enhancements, and extensive CFG backend refactoring work

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: Backend refactoring and Flambda2 performance optimization focus with new profiling capabilities
entry.content:
Summary

Performance analysis discussions and infrastructure planning dominated the week

Activity

  • Performance optimization discussions around imperative loops and allocation patterns with Patrick Nicodemus reporting Flambda2 performance findings (#3293)
  • Join performance infrastructure work by Basile Clément tracking compilation time issues up to 30% spent on joins (#3300)
  • Performance tracking infrastructure planning by Basile Clément for systematic measurement of stdlib, compiler, and opam package compilation times (#3299)
entry.summary: Backend refactoring and Flambda2 performance optimization focus with new profiling capabilities

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: Major week implementing frontend support for unboxed product arrays and strengthening uniqueness soundness
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive compiler development with 26 merged PRs focusing on unboxed types, uniqueness, and compiler infrastructure

Activity

  • Unboxed types infrastructure received major development with frontend support for product arrays (#3139), moving unboxed tuples to stable (#3246), and comprehensive test additions
  • Uniqueness analysis improvements including soundness fixes (#3247), documentation disclaimers (#3252), and protection against codegen pessimization (#3236)
  • Middle-end enhancements with or_null primitive support in Flambda2 (#3112), CSE environment error improvements (#3248), and unused kind computation removal (#3258)
  • Build system improvements including META file generation for otherlibs (#3254), autoconf script fixes (#3263), and dynlink parallelization (#3250)
  • Platform-specific fixes with ARM64 bytecode test disabling (#3276), float32 test restrictions to AMD64 (#3253), and partial inlining cflags corrections (#3264)
  • Code quality improvements including formatting fixes (#3279), Label.t abstraction (#3259), and Numbers.Int_base.compare fixes (#3268)
  • Syntax enhancements with modal module support (#3223), mode coercion restrictions (#3281), and variable binding reversion (#3278)
  • Version management with magic number bumps for 5.2.0minus-3 (#3260) and Apply return arity checking (#3270)
entry.summary: Major week implementing frontend support for unboxed product arrays and strengthening uniqueness soundness

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: Major backend refactoring week with new command-line switches, reader-writer locks, and extensive Flambda 2 type system improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Backend architecture underwent significant refactoring with Mach module split, Simple_operation extraction, and dataflow improvements

Activity

  • Backend architecture refactoring with Mark Shinwell splitting the Mach module for better modularity (#3234) and extracting Simple_operation module (#3235)
  • CFG pipeline improvements including minor refactoring of Cfg_selectgen (#3192) and dataflow bug fixes with Invalid extra_args (#3226)
  • Type system enhancements with jkind improvements for function type detection (#3244, #3245) and join handling for no-input scenarios (#3232)
  • Effect system corrections fixing stack manipulation inlining issues (#3231) and unique allocation read semantics (#3230)
  • Terminator simplification ensuring correct predecessor sets after optimization passes (#3227)
entry.summary: Major backend refactoring week with new command-line switches, reader-writer locks, and extensive Flambda 2 type system improvements

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: Extensive Flambda2 optimization work with reaper implementation, Jane Syntax removal, and backend improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Major infrastructure work with Jane Syntax removal, extensive Flambda2 optimization improvements, and multiple bug fixes

Activity

  • Major infrastructure cleanup with complete removal of Jane Syntax system simplifying parser and AST handling (da43185a)
  • Flambda2 optimization infrastructure improvements including light vs heavy invariant distinction (0559555), consistent variable binding times (40c4705b), and mode solver enhancements (f5d8aa1c)
  • Backend compilation fixes including SIMD ARM64 build fixes (21614a5c), CMM arity checks (87e7a70c), and cross-mode object handling (677386f2)
  • Runtime improvements with upstream port fixing issue 11865 (3b18c285) and unique barrier mapping (e2a2e0b9)
  • Development tooling with chamelon quality-of-life improvements (dd6652f0) and test infrastructure fixes (be190753)
entry.summary: Extensive Flambda2 optimization work with reaper implementation, Jane Syntax removal, and backend improvements

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Major pivot_root restructuring moved OCaml upstream content to repository root with significant compiler improvements and bug fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Major repository restructuring dominated the week alongside runtime fixes and compiler pipeline improvements

Activity

  • Repository pivot_root operation involved extensive file reorganization with over 30 commits dedicated to moving OCaml upstream content from ocaml/ subdirectory to repository root, affecting thousands of files and requiring careful history preservation (66cd3efb9, b4bc395006)
  • Runtime bug fixes included temporary fix for compaction/hugepage interaction preventing pool freeing (#3177), debug runtime assert fix (#3186), and objinfo.ml improvements for better upstream diffing (#3167)
  • Build system cleanup with README file reorganization (#3174) and removal of stale workflow configuration (#3173)
  • Compiler infrastructure enhancements through CFG selection improvements for AMD64 and ARM64 backends, plus register allocation optimizations using doubly-linked lists
entry.summary: Major pivot_root restructuring moved OCaml upstream content to repository root with significant compiler improvements and bug fixes

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: Repository restructuring with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime and flambda improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Major repository restructuring completed with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime issues addressed

Activity

  • Repository restructuring completed by moving entire backend/ directory structure to asmcomp/ location, affecting hundreds of files including compiler internals, architecture-specific code, and debugging infrastructure
  • Runtime compatibility addressed with Leo White reporting OCAMLRUNPARAM=v=4096 flag overloading issue where custom timestamp behavior conflicts with upstream OCaml 5.1 changes (#3158)
  • Flambda2 development progressed with Mark Shinwell closing continuation lifting issue after implementation completion (#2413)
  • Compiler optimizations delivered through multiple PRs including string scope refactoring (#3117), directory flag refactoring (#3120), and debuginfo comparison improvements (#3119)
  • Type system enhancements completed with layouts documentation for contravariance (#3144) and unboxed vector types mode crossing fixes (#3138)
  • Performance improvements achieved through array reference kind refactoring (#3152) and block header field reordering reversion (#3145)
entry.summary: Repository restructuring with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime and flambda improvements
